co.cask.cdap.api.data.batch

Class SplitReader<KEY,VALUE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.cdap.api.data.batch.SplitReader<KEY,VALUE>
  • Type Parameters:
    KEY - The key type.
    VALUE - The value type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KeyValueTable.KeyValueScanner, SplitReaderAdapter, SplitReaderBase

    public abstract class SplitReader<KEY,VALUE>
extends Object
    Defines a reader of a dataset Split.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize(Split split)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Called once at initialization.
        Parameters:
        split - The split that defines the range of records to read.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • nextKeyValue

        public abstract boolean nextKeyValue()
                              throws InterruptedException
        Read the next key, value pair.
        Returns:
        true if a key/value pair was read.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • getCurrentKey

        public abstract KEY getCurrentKey()
                           throws InterruptedException
        Get the current key.
        Returns:
        The current key, or null if there is no current key.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • getCurrentValue

        public abstract VALUE getCurrentValue()
                               throws InterruptedException
        Get the current value.
        Returns:
        The current value of the object that was read.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • getProgress

        public float getProgress()
                  throws InterruptedException
        The current progress of the record reader through its data. By default progress is not reported in the middle of split reading.
        Returns:
        A number between 0.0 and 1.0 that is the fraction of the data that has been read.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • close

        public abstract void close()
        Close the record reader.
